reviews.title: Top apartment
reviews.text: There's no need to look anywhere else. Clean roomy apartment , secure environment , friendly staff and a short walk to the V and A waterfront. The 5 star One and only hotel is right next door as well.This is the place to stay in Cape Town.

We stayed here for 5 nights and chose it because of its proximity to the waterfront. We could walk to a variety of restaurants, Robben Island tour and shops. The parking was easy and safe and we felt very secure. The 2 bedroom apartment was clean, modern and well appointed with even a washer and dryer. These US visitors do wish the appliances included directions!
reviews.title: Great location-wonderful apartment

reviews.text: A great location to explore Cape Town. The only problem was they lost our wire transfer deposit although we had followed their exact directions. It took awhile to clear it up. But, it was an excellent place to stay and we would book it again.
reviews.title: PERFECT STAY

reviews.text: A BIG Thank You to Safari-Online for booking this apartment.
reviews.title: Like having a hotel suite - for the price of room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location Perfect, close to shopping, activities, like the hop on hop of bus. Walking distance to the ferry to Robben Island. A lot of eating areas around.
reviews.title: BEST place to stay in Cape Town

reviews.text: Our family of four (kids 17, 11) enjoyed the elegance and great location of this marvelous apartment building. It was only a few steps to the tour bus headquarters and waterfront shopping/dining. Security was superb (with a 24-hour concierge) and the quality of the apartment was fabulous! Cape Town and the Lawhill Apartments were a real favorite for us during our 6-week journey through Africa.
reviews.title: Luxury on the Cape Town waterfront

reviews.text: We are staying here for three days as a family and having stayed in every other hotel and apartment in the area bar two, we are 100% sold on Lawhill for all our future stays too!
reviews.title: Mantis outdid itself with these apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose a 2 bedroom apartment (203) and walked into a beautifully designed interior with open plan reception and dining area, kitchen and lounge. Bedrooms each with en suite were to the right and left of the living area, the main overlooking the one & only hotel and the other looking onto the interior parking area. Parking was secure and free. One & only hotel breakfast vouchers were available for purchase, but with the V&A Waterfront just a short walk away we declined and chose a different spot to try every morning. My five year old loved the walk as we exited Lawhill onto the water channel. A short stint pass the one & only hotel, the aquarium and the warehouse, brings you to the market shed, the Victoria Alfred hotel and the main waterfront area.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Cape Town

reviews.text: A highly recommended property to anyone, family or business!
reviews.title: Can't wait to visit Lawhill Hotel Apartment next year :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lawhill apartments were a great place to stay in Cape Town. The location was excellent, situated on the V&A waterfront. The apartments are 2 minutes walk from the two oceans aquarium, which is great for picking up the hop on hop off bus (which I would recommend as a way to get around Cape Town as it takes you to Table Mountain and Kirstenbosch gardens. It is cheaper to buy in advance). The apartments have a bedroom, bathroom, living area, kitchen and balcony. They are well decorated and very clean. The kitchen has a cooker, hob, washing machine, tumble dryer, ironing board and iron, dishwasher and basic crockery (e.g. pans, plates etc). There is a Pick and Pay (supermarket) in the V&A shopping mall and a nice food hall on the waterfront. We bought food from the supermarket and had a cooked breakfast on the balcony every morning and made sandwiches for our day trips. The washing machine was great for catching up on our washing before our next travels. Everyday a cleaner came in to tidy the apartment which was great. The apartments were very secure; they were accessible by a key fob that you receive at reception. At night we travelled by taxi and they take you straight to the Lawhill apartments. The V&A waterfront has great shops and bars/restaurants so there is plenty to do. Look out for the odd seal at the harbour. If you are planning to go to Robben Island it is best to book in advance as we missed out thinking we could go on the day. In most areas of Cape Town you have fantastic views of Table Mountain which is a definite must for a visit. The staff in reception were very friendly and happy to book restaurants or taxis if requested.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Perfect location
reviews.text: Lawhill apartments are perfectly placed for families who want a safe central location in Cape Town and within easy walking distance of the many shops and excellent restaurants at the V&A Waterfront. The apartments are well designed and appointed, have secure parking and are set in a secure gated area with 24 hour security. The staff are friendly, professional and helpful. Overall a fantastic location for a family visiting Cape Town who want luxury accommodation and the space to stretch out.

Set on the marina boasting unrivaled views of the mountain and the one and only ...definitely a place to consider when in Cape Town for the unique position .a beautiful apartment with large spacious bedrooms and bathrooms that are tastefully decorated ,crisp clean linen down duvets and adequate heating . A fully fitted kitchenette with all the amenities ,,spacious lounge and outdoor and indoor dining areas .the one and only spa is just across and is highly recommended as one of the best in Cape Town discount vouchers offered towards treatments there as well as meals at the hotel. Close to town and the waterfront. The only place to stay when in Cape Town !
reviews.title: Unrivaled views and superb location

reviews.text: Our family just returned from our visit to Cape Town where we stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which was beautifully appointed, spacious and elegant. The location is perfect - just a few minutes walk to the heart of the V&A Waterfront with its restaurants and attractions. Staff were great, very helpful and accommodating. Thoroughly enjoyed our visit and can't imagine staying anywhere else on our next trip.
reviews.title: Perfect spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not only the location was fantastic, but the spacious flat, fully equipped kitchen, a patio with a small "private" pool, daily maintenance and last but not least , the helpful , warm staff were also remarkable.
reviews.title: Location and Luxury

reviews.text: Probably 20 restaurants, a couple of shopping centers, bus and taxi stops...all within 5 to 10 minutes walking distance
reviews.title: Central Location V & A Waterfront Cape Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second visit to the Lawhill Apartments. We had requested an apartment not on the ground floor but that is what we were given, the same one we had two years ago! It is a lovely apartment with a fully equipped kitchen. As we were only there for three nights, we did not cook but it was good to be able to get the washing machine going so we did not fly back to London with a case full of dirty clothes. It is a short walk to the V & A where there are many restaurants, our favourite being Den Anker. We returned each morning to a small cafe in the V & A we had found last visit. Breakfast was large and delicious. We walked around the paths next to the canals watching the passing paddlers and small boats.
reviews.title: Very good location for a stay in Cape Town

reviews.text: I have stayed at several hotels in Cape Town but none compare to the Lawhill.
reviews.title: Excellent apartments overlooking V&A marina

reviews.text: My family stayed here for a week and loved the convenience of the apartments. Fully equipped 2br/2ba apartment with huge balcony overlooking the canals at the marina. Easy walk to V&A - less than 10 mins. Right next door to The One and Only hotel which offers some restaurant options, including Nobu and Reubens. Very modern look and feel, very clean and easy to live in. I wish I lived here in fact.... We would definitely stay there again on our next trip to CPT.
reviews.title: Better than a hotel

reviews.text: We booked into a 2 bedroom Lawhill Apartment for 6 days after disembarking from the QM2 in Cape Town after spending 20 days at sea.
reviews.title: Incredible location and 5* standards

reviews.text: It was so lovely to have so much space and to be able to make your own (simple) breakfast in the wonderfully appointed kitchen.
reviews.title: What a Place to Stay
